content:
by Jessica GalliartNovember  

The Chicago Transit Authority announced on Nov PERIOD  an extended service plan to better serve customers during downtown election night festivities including rushhour service on rail lines and additional bus service in the Loop PERIOD

According to the CTA website rush hour service will begin in the afternoon for riders attempting to leave work in the Loop early in anticipation of Sen PERIOD Barack Obamas election rally in Grant Park PERIOD Also bicycles will not be permitted on rail lines after  p.m PERIOD on Nov PERIOD  until  a.m PERIOD the next day PERIOD

Owl latenight service on buses leaving downtown will be added to  more bus routes on Nov PERIOD  in addition to the  routes that previously offered the latenight service PERIOD Due to numerous street closures throughout downtown the CTA will have three different loading points for buses leaving the Loop PERIOD All northbound buses will board at Lasalle Street between Van Buren and Randolph streets southbound buses will board at Clark Street between Van Buren and Randolph streets and westbound buses will board at Madison between Dearborn and Clark streets PERIOD

For rail lines service in the Loop will be extended on the Brown Pink Green and Orange lines until  a.m PERIOD or later PERIOD Also Purple and Yellow lines will run from Howard until  a.m PERIOD or later PERIOD

Columbias class schedule has been suspended after  p.m. and the campus will close at  p.m. with exceptions for student media and the Columbia chapter of American Civil Liberties Unions View and Skew election watching party at Plymouth Court  S PERIOD Plymouth Court PERIOD

For more information visit TransitChicago.com PERIOD

The Chronicle will have continuous coverage of Election Day  PERIOD Keep checking back for more updates PERIOD
